subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods, its urgent
msgSnippet: ... I agree but sometimes the public methods can not be easily tested as is (mainly because the design is not test-friendly). In that case: junit-addons on
messageBody:
> Why do you think you need to test private methods? Private methods
> support public methods. Therefore well tested public methods will
> include the behaviour of the private methods.
>
> There is no real reason for directly testing private methods.

I agree but sometimes the public methods can not be easily tested "as is"
(mainly because the design is not test-friendly).

In that case: junit-addons on SourceForge. First use the PrivateAccessor class
to test the private methods and then refactor your code to make your design more
test-friendly.

-Vladimir
